_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:33:27 using v2.0
title: Does feeling supported to manage their long-term condition(s) differ by age?
analysis_commentary:
Patients feeling that they are supported to manage their long-term condition(s) is a measure in the NHS Outcomes Framework (2012/2013) and the GP patient survey data has been analysed and published to investigate how different cohorts of patients feel about whether they feel supported to manage their long-term condition(s) as part of this programme.

There was no difference in both 2011/2012 and 2012/2013 in how the sexes responded (data not shown). However, there is variation between different age groups in how patients feel about being supported. Fewer patients in the younger age groups feel supported to manage their long-term condition(s), especially in the 18 to 24 and the 25 to 34 age groups, where only 56% of patients in each group responded that they felt supported in 2012/13. The 65 to 74 year old age group felt supported to manage their long-term condition(s) the most (78% in 2012/13).
